pages.text: $(thing)Canning Food$() is another method of preservation. Combining ingredients or soups with a tin can, then sealing the can, makes food last longer.$(br2)Canned foods lose some nutritional value; so although they last longer, their nutrition wanes.$(br2)$(thing)Tin Cans$() are made on the anvil.
The $(thing)Canning Press$() is used to seal canned food items.$(br2)Unsealed cans will expire faster than sealed cans.
pages.title: Canning Press

pages.text: The $(thing)Electric Grill$(), with 10 slots, is an upgrade to cooking over a $(thing)Firepit$().$(br2)The power draw is the same when cooking one item or ten, so bulk cooking is advised.
pages.title: Electric Grill

pages.text: The $(thing)Fridge$() is a long term food storage device. It has 9 slots for keeping items preserved and cannot hold canned food or other inventories; i.e. small vessels.$(br2)The Fridge will only consume power if there is an item inside.
pages.title: Fridge

pages.text: The $(thing)Fridge$() requires $(thing)Purple Steel$(), making it challenging to obtain.
